body: Should be the last part of network cleanup. I can split it on few PRs if it's needed. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/515)

comment_regular_data.body: I think splitting in two or three parts would be appropriate, because right now it is huge.

osx is still broken :/

*[auto_tests/dht_test.c, line 100 at r5](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/515#-Kh_1T0qkcDtBgIeWQCv:-Kh_1T0qkcDtBgIeWQCw:b-6lf29g) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/124d9e0446856002d9d19abddae12107345d67bc/auto_tests/dht_test.c#L100)):*
> ```C
>     IP_Port test_ipp;
>     uint8_t test_id[CRYPTO_PUBLIC_KEY_SIZE];
>     uint8_t ipv6 = ip_port->ip.family == AF_INET6 ? 1 : 0;
> ```

Did you remove the file which defines `AF_INET6` in this scope, so that in case you have missed one, it won't compile because `AF_INET6` is not defined?

---

*[auto_tests/network_test.c, line 74 at r5](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/515#-Kh_1zdAV9xYfzANCkaC:-Kh_1zdAV9xYfzANCkaD:b-kap8n) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/e3e3e2a8887c942b3f269701218a822d1304c0ec/auto_tests/network_test.c#L74)):*
> ```C
> 
>     ck_assert_msg(extra.family == TOX_AF_INET, "Expected family TOX_AF_INET (%u), got %u.", TOX_AF_INET, extra.family);
>     ck_assert_msg(extra.ip4.uint32 == net_htonl(0x7F000001), "Expected 127.0.0.1, got %s.",
> ```

Hm, so you use `ip6_loopback` for IPv6, but `net_htonl(0x7F000001)` for IPv4? Why not rewrite this to use `ip4_loopback`? There are also other places where `net_htonl(0x7F000001)` is used which could be rewritten to use `ip4_loopback`.

---

*[auto_tests/TCP_test.c, line 37 at r5](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/515#-Kh_3RFiFtqrJ_UczuHJ:-Kh_3RFjqTIfQY9-TkRL:b-q17a0l) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/e3e3e2a8887c942b3f269701218a822d1304c0ec/auto_tests/TCP_test.c#L37)):*
> ```C
>     IP_Port ip_port_loopback;
>     ip_port_loopback.ip.family = TOX_AF_INET6;
>     ip_port_loopback.ip.ip6.uint64[0] = 0;
> ```

Shouldn't we use `ip6_loopback` in here instead of manually specifying `::1`?

*[toxcore/network.h, line 187 at r8](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/515#-KqptarEOK5oGpGdBdvh:-KqptarEOK5oGpGdBdvi:b-m4c8lb) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/2d33736f4ff8cbc4c7488133d604a9f3df9c89f8/toxcore/network.h#L187)):*
> ```objc
> 
> #define TOX_INET_ADDRSTRLEN 16
> #define TOX_INET6_ADDRSTRLEN 46
> ```

Why is this needed? Doesn't seem like this helps with anything. `INET6_ADDRSTRLEN` and `INET_ADDRSTRLEN` seem fine as they are.

*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/515)*

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions, all commit checks successful. --- *[toxcore/Messenger.c, line 2531 at r7](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/515#-KlsnvQHWjIvJx1-e6T-:-KqqJQviy2BjyrT-OxGj:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/01b6be7b2d9b3a9b10d8bf4d2f9103e91c904862/toxcore/Messenger.c#L2531)):*
Previously, nurupo wrote…
@iphydf has pointed out that this is not portable change. You use `IP4_LOOPBACK` to replace `INADDR_LOOPBACK`, but `IP4_LOOPBACK` is a `uint8_t` array of `{127, 0, 0, 1}`, while `INADDR_LOOPBACK` is a `0x7f000001` integer. They equal on big-endian machines, but they are not equal on little-endian. `IP4_LOOPBACK` initialized that way stays the same in memory no matter the endianness, but `INADDR_LOOPBACK` changes its memory representation with the change of endianness.
Done. --- *[toxcore/network.h, line 187 at r8](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/515#-KqptarEOK5oGpGdBdvh:-KqqJRUN-mqPV8n0ajih:b-kuzkby) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/2d33736f4ff8cbc4c7488133d604a9f3df9c89f8/toxcore/network.h#L187)):*
Previously, nurupo wrote…
Why is this needed? Doesn't seem like this helps with anything. `INET6_ADDRSTRLEN` and `INET_ADDRSTRLEN` seem fine as they are.
`INET6_ADDRSTRLEN` and `INET_ADDRSTRLEN` are system-dependent constants --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/515)*

Review status: 19 of 20 files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion, all commit checks successful. --- *[toxcore/network.h, line 187 at r8](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/515#-KqptarEOK5oGpGdBdvh:-KqyknY5BHSX4mqgGI7n:bwp1fwl) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/2d33736f4ff8cbc4c7488133d604a9f3df9c89f8/toxcore/network.h#L187)):*
Previously, Diadlo (Polshakov Dmitry) wrote…
`INET6_ADDRSTRLEN` and `INET_ADDRSTRLEN` are system-dependent constants
Then add asserts in `network.c` to check that `TOX_INET_ADDRSTRLEN` constants are indeed equal to `INET_ADDRSTRLEN` on the target system, since we assume that to be true by using `inet_ntop()` this way. Those asserts might seem pointless, I myself can't imagine those constants to be re-defined to be equal to anything other than what we assume them to be, but it's something we have to check regardless. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/515)*

Review status: 18 of 20 files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion. --- *[toxcore/network.h, line 187 at r8](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/515#-KqptarEOK5oGpGdBdvh:-KrHP5qH6QeGWZYfSvwY:b-thj93p) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/2d33736f4ff8cbc4c7488133d604a9f3df9c89f8/toxcore/network.h#L187)):*

--- Reviewed 2 of 2 files at r9. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions. --- *[toxcore/network.h, line 187 at r8](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/515#-KqptarEOK5oGpGdBdvh:-KrHW033Msnn7qjk4Hhw:b8xez4d) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/2d33736f4ff8cbc4c7488133d604a9f3df9c89f8/toxcore/network.h#L187)):* Heh. This shows that assuming things in C is dangerous. While 16 and 46 look perfectly fine for the `xxx.xxx.xxx` and `xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx` IP notations, `inet_ntop()` specifically says that >The buffer dst must be at least INET6_ADDRSTRLEN bytes long so it could potentially have written 22 or 66 bytes on your system, which would result in a buffer overflow, which is why I said that it's something we have to check. --- *[toxcore/onion.c, line 83 at r9](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/515#-KrH_X_RFjKpKg0nRBCN:-KrH_X_RFjKpKg0nRBCO:b-d41ddv) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/67afa3ff93d2c6764dfc8cd226d17a492fc0079f/toxcore/onion.c#L83)):* > ```C > target->family == TOX_AF_INET6; > > return valid ? 0 : -1; > ``` Hm, weird, shouldn't this function succeed for `target->family == == TOX_TCP_INET`? @irungentoo @Diadlo, it's not an issue with your PR but with the original code. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/515#-:-KrHZ2HybpQ6DWztn4d9:b-jbsf8z)*

Please rebase on master. In https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/commit/889d25f819ff2ebbbbf9b553db49860c6a0bd49c, I have edited `Messenger.c` to define `INADDR_LOOPBACK` because it wasn't defined on FreeBSD. You might want to remove all my additions from that commit because your PR replaces the only use of `INADDR_LOOPBACK` in `Messenger.c` with `IP4_LOOPBACK`, which would be defined on FreeBSD because we define it ourselves.
@nurupo Thank you for reminding! Done
Check Travis, looks like it fails to build on FreeBSD.
You could move changes from https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/commit/889d25f819ff2ebbbbf9b553db49860c6a0bd49c to `network.c` to fix that.
@nurupo Done

Looks good to me.

Would still like to see @irungentoo answer my question, but don't let that block the PR from being merged.
